title: (x) Vintage sans in 1910 Miller Mica Spark Plug ad - Pastel Bold {Nick Shin}
content:
“The Miller Mica Spark Plug”

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080424030409im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture1_3688.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080424030409im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture2_6313.jpg)

 [‹ (x) CorrectVision stressed sans logo - Optima {Marc 0}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080424030409/http:/typophile.com/node/42677 "Go to previous forum topic") [New Testament blackletter ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080424030409/http:/typophile.com/node/42452 "Go to next forum topic")
author: eliason

comments.content: [Clearface Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20080424030409/http:/www.paratype.com/fstore/default.asp?fcode=97&search=Clearface+Gothic) might be close, or [Dyna Grotesk](http://web.archive.org/web/20080424030409/http:/www.stormtype.com/typefaces-fonts-shop/typefaces-296-dynagrotesk-lxe-bold) sort of?
Pastel Bold, Barnhart Brothers and Spindler.
I think you got it. Thanks!
Yes, there is a little bit of humanism in the lower case, along with Art Nouveau in the caps, and Plate Gothic in general.
